Description: A white plaster rear-mould for a terracotta figure of a cockerel, modelled in the round and standing on a conical plinth. There are four registration bosses on the edges.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Purchased: Chauncey Murch. Probably Roman, first or second century AD. Comparanda: Close: Edgar 1903a: pl. xxvii:32211, a plaster rear-mould for a cockerel facing in the opposite direction. Near: Dunand 1990: no. 893, a figure from Antinoopolis, dated second to third century AD.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3773)
